location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 17/5 II Furniture and Stores for the Political Agency, Bahrain

physicalDescription.extent: Papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 181; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.Two additional foliation sequences are also present in parallel between ff 2-138, and ff 140-178; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: Correspondence between the Political Agency, Bahrain, and various merchants regarding furniture and office supply orders, plus receipts and bills. The file also contains correspondence with the British Air Forces in Iraq and Bahrain regarding the supply of fire extinguishers.The following businesses are included among the correspondents: Tonks Birmingham Ltd.; Byculla Iron Works and Bombay Metal Mart; Turners Asbestos Cement Co.; the Bahrain Petroleum Company Ltd (BAPCO); the Royal Bombay Seamen's Society; Imperial and International Communications Ltd.; George Jones & Sons Ltd.; Story & Co. Ltd.; Haroon Shamoon; F P Barker & Co. Ltd.; Richardson & Cruddas Ironworks, Bombay; the Mesopotamia Persia Corporation Ltd.; Eastern Bank Ltd.; B R Herman & Mohatta Ltd.; the British India Steam Navigation Co. Ltd.; and Army & Navy Co-operative Society.
